intro: Vernonia galamensis var. petitiana, commonly known as the Galamense ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of yellow to orange flowering heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense, conical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
